tidybrookes 0.1

  • Reference

    Rename to tidy column names

    rename.Rd

    Rename columns from the default names in the standard data format from Clinical Informatics into standardised, shorter names (e.g. all lowercase, underscore-separated, with _datetime suffix etc).

    Usage

    default_rename(x)

adm_rename(x, names = default_rename("adm"))

adt_rename(x, names = default_rename("adt"))

demogs_rename(x, names = default_rename("demogs"))

diagnosis_pl_rename(x, names = default_rename("diagnosis_pl"))

fsheet_io_rename(x, names = default_rename("fsheet_io"))

fsheet_rename(x, names = default_rename("fsheet"))

med_admin_rename(x, names = default_rename("med_admin"))

med_hist_rename(x, names = default_rename("med_hist"))

med_prescr_rename(x, names = default_rename("med_prescr"))

radiology_rename(x, names = default_rename("radiology"))

tests_rename(x, names = default_rename("tests"))

    Arguments

    x

    A data frame of raw adm data

    names

    A vector of new_name = old_name pairs

    Value

    The supplied data frame, with column names in tidy-column-name format

    Details

    The default renaming map can be viewed using default_rename().

    If variations from this format occur, custom renaming can be performed using the names argument.

    See also

    unrename to reverse this process

    Author

    R.J.B. Goudie

    Examples

    # The raw columns names are messy: long names, mixed capitalisation, etc!
fsheet_imported_example <-
  read_tidybrookes_csv(
    file = tidybrookes_example("fsheet.csv"),
    col_types = "fsheet"
  )
colnames(fsheet_imported_example)
#>  [1] "STUDY_SUBJECT_DIGEST" "fsd_id"               "line"                 "flo-meas_id"          "MEASURE_TIME"         "disp_name"            "measured_value"       "meas_comment"        
#>  [9] "template"             "form"                

# Default renaming can be viewed with
default_rename("fsheet")
#>              person_id                   name                  value                comment   measurement_datetime                data_id         measurement_id                line_id 
#> "STUDY_SUBJECT_DIGEST"            "disp_name"       "measured_value"         "meas_comment"         "MEASURE_TIME"               "fsd_id"          "flo-meas_id"                 "line" 
#>               template                   form 
#>             "template"                 "form" 

colnames(fsheet_rename(fsheet_imported_example))
#>  [1] "person_id"            "data_id"              "line_id"              "measurement_id"       "measurement_datetime" "name"                 "value"                "comment"             
#>  [9] "template"             "form"                

# A warning is issued if columns are missing
fsheet_imported_example %>%
  select(-MEASURE_TIME) %>%
  fsheet_rename
#> ! Some columns were missing: MEASURE_TIME
#> # A tibble: 32 × 9
#>    person_id  data_id line_id measurement_id name        value comment template  form       
#>    <chr>        <int>   <int> <chr>          <chr>       <chr> <chr>   <chr>     <chr>      
#>  1 AA               5      61 1234           Weight      4125  NA      IP Vitals Vital signs
#>  2 AA        10909029      60 10             SpO2        96    NA      IP Vitals Vital signs
#>  3 AA        10909029      60 10             SpO2        90    NA      IP Vitals Vital signs
#>  4 AA        10926333     239 1234           NEWS2 score 3     NA      IP Vitals Vital signs
#>  5 AA        10926333     239 1234           NEWS2 score 4     NA      IP Vitals Vital signs
#>  6 AA        10926333     239 1234           NEWS2 score 3     NA      IP Vitals Vital signs
#>  7 AA        10909029      60 10             SpO2        96    NA      IP Vitals Vital signs
#>  8 AA        10909029      60 10             SpO2        90    NA      IP Vitals Vital signs
#>  9 AA        10909029      60 10             SpO2        92    NA      IP Vitals Vital signs
#> 10 AA        10926333     239 1234           NEWS2 score 3     NA      IP Vitals Vital signs
#> # ℹ 22 more rows
